income_messages:
From: m**************2@gmail.com
To: CRAWLER
Time: 2023-03-01 16:17:38
SUBJECT:   Attention: Valued Fund Benef
  Attention: Valued Fund Beneficiary,
As a matter of urgency, we wish to know if you are the original owner of this email account which this message is being sent to. We do have some details of yours but we want to be sure that you are the one who owns and access this email account, we ask because of the sensitivity of the information we are about to furnish you with; it regards the payment of huge compensation sum which is due to the owner of the email address receiving this message.
For us to be sure about the ownership of this email, we ask that you provide your details so we can cross-check with the ones we have here on the payment file. We are taking this preventive measure because we do not want to communicate with the wrong person. I have your email address and other details, however the confirmation of other details such as name, home address, occupation, age and phone number will be used to confirm if you are really the owner of the email account.
Please be informed that every measure that we have taken regarding this matter is for security reasons which we believe is for your own good, therefore we advise you to cooperate with us, we are working according to instructions from the U.S Government so please bear with us.
We look forward to your expedient response.
Yours sincerely,
Matthew Garth
Operational Manager
Debt Management Services (DMS)
Bureau of the Fiscal Service.   
From: m**************2@gmail.com
To: gj51102@m**************p
Time: 2023-03-02 16:25:28
SUBJECT: Attention: Paul
Debt Management Services
Bureau of the Fiscal Service
Department of the Treasury
401 14th Street, SW., Room 446
Washington, DC 20227
Attention: Paul,
This is to acknowledge the receipt of your message. Well, on behalf of the
entire chief executives of the Debt Management Services (DMS); Bureau of
the Fiscal Service, I wish to bring to your notice that we have confirmed
that you are the original owner of this email (
gj51102@mailserver.sdchaos.top ). We were able to ascertain that you are
the real owner of the email account after we did cross-checking of the
email you sent and compared it to the ones on the payment file we have with
us, I’m glad to inform you that it matches. Now we shall further give you
full details concerning the payment and the reason why you are going to be
compensated.
I am happy that you responded to me, this shows your level of seriousness
in this matter, I will not disappoint you, since you are ready to cooperate
and comply with me. I don’t want this investigation to be only for the sake
of you receiving your compensation fund, but I also want to see that all
the parties that were involved in the execution of the dubious/fraudulent
act are brought to book.
I'm a man of integrity, I have been assigned by the Treasury Department to
handle this project because of my sincerity, and also because of the level
of dedication I have not just to my office but also to the Government of
the United States.
Following the combined effort of the Government of the United States in
conjunction with the United Nations (UN), European Union (EU), Africa Unity
(AU) and International Monetary Fund (IMF), investigations and subsequent
arrests of suspected fraudsters\scammers in African, Asia and Europe has
led to the recovery of a six hundred and ninety-five million U.S dollars
($695,000,000.00 USD). Terrorism and Financial Intelligence (TFI) has
immensely contributed to the success of the U.S Government on the recovery
of this fund. TFI develops and implements U.S. government strategies to
combat terrorist financing domestically and internationally, develops and
implements the National Money Laundering Strategy as well as other policies
and programs to fight financial crimes. Investigation carried out by the
TFI authorities state that in the last eighteen months the United States
has lost over 90 million dollars to fraudsters, which means they deserve
the highest share of the recovered fund to enable them to compensate scam
victims within the U.S.and aside the U.S. The money recovered is a small
portion of the amount U.S citizens have lost to scammers over the years,
more funds are being recovered.
Sequel to this development, 45% of the total amount of the funds recovered
from the criminals has been awarded to the U.S Government to compensate all
fund beneficiaries. The U.S Treasury Department has therefore assigned the
Debt Management Service, Bureau of the Fiscal Service to pay all scam
victims the sum of Eight million six hundred thousand dollars
($8,600,000.00 USD), however only scam victims whose details are on our
payment file will be compensated. The Financial Crimes Enforcement Network
(FinCEN) has submitted an archive of the victims which has been put into
three groups. Presently, those in group one of the list are being paid and
you are lucky to be one of those on the list, those in group two and three
will be paid subsequently next year.
Be informed that you will be paid through our subsidiary banks, your fund
will be transferred through Bank to Bank. This is the mode of payment
recommended by The Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN). It is to
enable a very swift and secured release of each beneficiary’s entitlement,
so we advise you to cooperate with us while we forward your details to our
subsidiary bank to effect your payment with your account details and then
furnish you with the necessary particulars to enable you access the fund
for your use.
So far, eighteen beneficiaries have been paid, all of them have received
their funds and now they have full access to their funds, so please do not
worry about this method of payment as it is the best for this project .
The sum of $8.6 Million USD will be credited into your account. Be assured
that you will receive this compensation payment without delays or troubles,
and it is 100% legal and risk free.
I’m looking forward to your speedy response
Matthew Garth
Operational Manager
Debt Management Services (DMS).
outbound_messages:
From: gj51102@m**************p
To: m**************2@gmail.com
Time: 2023-03-01 16:17:40
SUBJECT: Re:   Attention: Valued Fund Benef
How is it that you keep asking for payment of and have waited for some time for it, this is very clever.I'll see if can find good hiding SPIT?
Best,
Paul
From: gj51102@m**************p
To: m**************2@gmail.com
Time: 2023-03-02 17:17:11
SUBJECT: Re: Attention: Paul
Well, not really too happy about everything that has happened. You have made me very sad and had lot of fun in my life. Things are definitely better for me than they were year before.
Best,
Paul
